spas.usercontrol

Class UserHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • spas.usercontrol.UserHandler

  • public class UserHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for making and updating a user's login information from the security-perspective. The XML-perspective is handled in UserLoginHandler. Also contains a few methods that only call handler's respective methods, because for security reasons, handler shouldn't be accessed from outside. Using code from here as a base.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    1.2.1
    Author:
    Lauri Lavanti

    • Field Detail

      • ITERATION_COUNT

        private static final int ITERATION_COUNT
        The count for how many times a password will be digested during encryption. Should be at least 1000.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setPath

        public void setPath(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the path to userfile. Must be set before doing anything.
        Parameters:

      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String pword)
        Authentication method, also contains some anti-hacking aspects.
        Parameters:
        username - The user's registered login name.
        pword - The user's registered password.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, authentication was successful.

      • createUser

        public boolean createUser(java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String pword,
                 java.lang.String email,
                 java.lang.String modelpath)
        Creates a new file containing user's login information using file-handler. Encrypts user's password for security purposes.
        Parameters:
        username - The login name for new user.
        pword - The user's password.
        email - User's email. Used in case user forgot password.
        modelpath - The absolute path to the file containing a user-file's model.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, nothing went wrong with user creation.
        See Also:
        XML-perspective

      • removeUser

        public boolean removeUser(java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String pword)
        Removes user from database. Be careful not to call this unnecessarily, because this is final.
        Parameters:
        username - The loginname for the user to be deleted.
        pword - The password for the user to be deleted.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, user was removed successfully.
        See Also:
        XML-perspective.

        Parameters:

        oldpword - User's registered password.
        newpword - New password.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, change was successful.
        See Also:
        XML-perspective.

      • validateUser

        public boolean validateUser(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String id)
        Check to see if given user is correct one. Session id is here for security purposes.
        Parameters:
        username - User's registered login name.
        id - User's current session id.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, user is correct.
        See Also:
        XML-perspective.

      • logIn

        Logs user's session-id into file.
        Parameters:
        username - User's registered login name.
        id - User's current session id.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, nothing went wrong.
        See Also:

      • logOut

        public boolean logOut(java.lang.String username)
        Logs user out. Removes user's session-id from file.
        Parameters:
        username - User's registered login name.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, nothing went wrong.

      • getHash

        private static byte[] getHash(java.lang.String pword,
             byte[] salt)
        Encrypts given password using salt. Uses algorithm that makes password non-decryptable, because no-one should ever be able to see passwords. Salt is used to make passwords secure against precomputed hashes (see here). The reason for all this is that mostly all algorithms used for encryption are open source.
        Parameters:
        pword - The password to be encrypted.
        salt - The salt to use in encryption. It should be a randomly generated number, and preferrably of fixed length.
        Returns:
        Encrypted password.

      • createSalt

        static byte[] createSalt()
        Creates a randomly generated salt. Salt is used in password encryption to counter against precomputed hashes and the birthday paradox.
        Returns:
        The created salt.

      • base64ToByte

        static byte[] base64ToByte(java.lang.String data)
        From a base 64 representation, returns the corresponding byte[].
        Parameters:
        data - The base 64 representation.
        Returns:
        The byte[] representation of given String.

      • byteToBase64

        static java.lang.String byteToBase64(byte[] data)
        From a byte[] returns a base 64 representation.
        Parameters:
        data - The byte[] to encode.
        Returns:
        Base 64 representation of given byte[].
